articles.title: Getting Started with Knowledge Base POC
articles.content: Welcome to the Knowledge Base POC platform. This guide will walk you through the initial setup process. First, ensure you have valid credentials from your administrator. Navigate to the login page and enter your email and password. Once authenticated, you'll see the main search interface where you can query across all connected knowledge bases.
articles.author: System Admin

articles.title: How to Search Effectively
articles.content: The search functionality allows you to query multiple knowledge bases simultaneously. Use specific keywords for better results. Boolean operators like AND, OR are supported. Enclose phrases in quotes for exact matches. Filter results by category or knowledge base source using the sidebar controls.
articles.author: Product Team

articles.title: User Roles and Permissions
articles.content: The platform supports two user roles: Support Agent and Admin. Support Agents can search and view content across all knowledge bases but cannot modify configurations. Admins have full access including the ability to add/remove knowledge base connections, manage user accounts, and configure search parameters.
articles.author: Security Team

articles.title: API Reference - Search Endpoint
articles.content: The /api/search endpoint accepts POST requests with a query parameter. Returns unified results from all configured knowledge bases. Response includes article title, excerpt, source KB, relevance score, and direct link. Rate limited to 100 requests per minute per user.
articles.author: Engineering Team

articles.title: Configuring Knowledge Base Connections
articles.content: Admins can add new knowledge base connections through the Settings panel. Each connection requires a name, type, and authentication credentials. Supported types include JSON, Database, and API endpoints. Test connections before saving to ensure proper configuration. Changes take effect immediately.
articles.author: Product Team

articles.title: Troubleshooting Search Issues
articles.content: If searches return no results, verify that knowledge bases are properly connected in Settings. Check that your user account has appropriate permissions. Clear browser cache if results appear stale. Contact your administrator if issues persist. Common issues include expired credentials, network connectivity problems, or malformed queries.
articles.author: Support Team

articles.title: Best Practices for Content Organization
articles.content: Organize knowledge base content with clear, descriptive titles. Use consistent tagging conventions across articles. Keep content up-to-date and archive outdated information. Include relevant keywords in article text for better searchability. Structure content with clear headings and sections.
articles.author: Content Team

articles.title: Security and Data Privacy
articles.content: All data transmitted between your browser and our servers is encrypted using TLS 1.3. User passwords are hashed using bcrypt. Access logs are maintained for audit purposes. Knowledge base credentials are encrypted at rest. Regular security audits are performed quarterly.
articles.author: Security Team

articles.title: Understanding Search Results Ranking
articles.content: Search results are ranked by relevance using a combination of keyword matching, recency, and user engagement metrics. Results from multiple knowledge bases are merged and deduplicated. AI-powered semantic search helps surface contextually relevant content even when exact keywords don't match.
articles.author: Product Team

articles.title: Mobile Access and Responsive Design
articles.content: The Knowledge Base POC platform is fully responsive and works on mobile devices. Access the same URL from your phone or tablet. Touch-optimized interface provides easy navigation on smaller screens. All features available on desktop are accessible on mobile.
articles.author: UX Team
